intro: Thrixspermum teysmannii, commonly known as the hairy ant plant, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
